HOOK: Top producers already know your kids' soccer team before they knock on your door. [ON-SCREEN: "They know before they arrive"]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: You've been there — sitting across from potential sellers, scrambling for something to connect on while they size you up as a stranger. Meanwhile, the agent who listed their neighbor's house last month felt like family from minute one. [ON-SCREEN: "Struggling to connect?"]
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: Here's how Tim Burrell — Raleigh's top producer — closes that gap in sixty seconds.

INSIGHT: Before every listing appointment, Tim feeds one simple prompt to ChatGPT: the prospect's name plus their social profiles. [ON-SCREEN: "60 seconds with AI"] The AI scans their background, education, business experience, then compares their social media to his. It finds the commonalities — your kids both play travel soccer, you went to similar schools, you root for the same teams. [ON-SCREEN: "Finds common ground instantly"] Tim says, "AI can give you information about the other person, helping you establish rapport and find common ground." [ON-SCREEN: "Walk in already connected"] He walks into that appointment already knowing three things they have in common.

REFRAME: Most agents walk in cold and hope chemistry happens. Top producers manufacture connection before they arrive. [ON-SCREEN: "Manufacture connection"] You can do this for your next appointment today.

CTA: "Will you try this prompt before your next listing appointment — yes or no?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---

CAPTION: This 60-second AI hack helps top producers connect instantly with listing prospects. Tim Burrell shares his exact process.

HASHTAGS: #RealEstate #ListingAgent #AI #RealtorTips #SalesStrategy

SHAREABLE_MOMENT: "Most agents walk in cold and hope chemistry happens. Top producers manufacture connection before they arrive."

PERFORMANCE_NOTES: 
1. Emphasize "sixty seconds" with a pause after — let that sink in
2. Slow down on the Tim Burrell quote for maximum impact and quotability  
3. Direct eye contact on the final CTA question — make it conversational, not scripted
